channel.title: davewiner tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from davewiner.

item.description:
I got my iPhone on opening day thanks to @scobleizer and his son Patrick who waited in line at the store in Palo Alto. I thought for sure I wouldn't use the iPhone, I liked my Blackberry too much. Turns out I never used the Blackberry again.
Scoble was a media star then, so I got my iPhone working before he did. He was busy being interviewed on TV. I was across the street at a coffee place, figuring out how to get it working.
Of course I wrote all about it on my blog, that's what blogs are for as you know.
https://t.co/SssWEKOWjk
My initial review of the iPhone.
https://t.co/lcrkhNf1ns
I had a product back then called Twittergram.
Yeah it was Instagram before there was Instagram.
https://t.co/8coj1mutY2
I couldn't get VCs to listen to me.
So it goes.
msnbc is waiting for trump's supporters to change. the rest of us are waiting for msnbc to get the idea that it's time to fight back and stop waiting for absolution from trump's supporters.

chris hayes has finally figured out that what's happening now is not in any way new.
chris the mob has ruled this company since inception.
we had a temporary slight reprieve since the 60s.

The founders of the United States were slavers.
Imagine if you were Jewish and the high court of your country said the only thing that matters is what Adolf Hitler wanted to do.
Anti-abortion lawmakers seek to block patients from crossing state lines. https://t.co/eH0aruIiJM
Why didnâ€™t journos figure this in the 17 months since Jan 6? https://t.co/JxnE147iDT
Dems Need to Stop Acting Like Victims and Swing Back. https://t.co/vtk3rYK9d7
https://t.co/jh7mTc0lxh
@dbfarber savagery and depravity even.
2001: Internet 3.0. https://t.co/jBrRflsmQA
I get a feeling that web3 is going to be like the semantic web. https://t.co/qK0yiMdNov It was supposed to set the world on fire, for some reason I never understood. How long do you have to wait?
Stephen Breyer makes it official: He's leaving the Supreme Court on Thursday at noon. https://t.co/YDQBWIgdzt percent3A30 percent3A24
@jayrosen_nyu @EricSchultz this just in to the situation room, Cillizza is an idiot.
that says more about the united states than facebook. guns and weed are slightly illegal. abortion was legal, on its way to being very illegal. https://t.co/ejLBVXRP43
The Supreme Court is beneath contempt.

How we will know slavery and racism are behind us in America. We will teach American children that many of our ancestors, the people who built this country, were slaves. If that rubs you wrong, there's your racism, right there.
Some day all Americans will understand that our ancestors were slaves.

Interesting headline. We only need 2 more Dems to do X. Gamify elections. Set goals for ourselves. Bring the people onto the team. Democrats: More of that. It's not enough to say "I see you" -- those are just words. Act on it. We need a people's party. https://t.co/2aDyp7b4UR
Toward that end I also suggest stealing an idea from Newt's 1994 contract with america.
I want the Dems to commit that they will in fact do these things if we the electorate do exactly what you ask us to.
More on this --
https://t.co/eAp5sCpjKk
that means getting it in writing from Manchin and Sinema, to be clear. and all the others.
When writing code I'm writing primarily for..
@AirborneGeek I think states are the problem too. ;-)
NATO invites Finland, Sweden to join, says Russia is a "direct threat." https://t.co/jw0uHI7LhO
@mattcrwi Interesting. I bought a Model Y last year, my first Tesla, and I find the self-driving feature is impressive and useful, most definitely not a failure. Different point of view.
@BeschlossDC @Morning_Joe Didnâ€™t the people with the guns march to the Capitol with the rest?
@mattcrwi Who says itâ€™s a failure?

Should we get rid of.. (pick one)
Clue: one of them includes all the others.
Getting rid of the electoral college is the weakest of the options. Very rarely does the president get elected without having a majority of the voters. And it only applies to the president. Congress will still be completely dysfunctional.
